page.title: Species
page.introduction: In BioModels, species are used to define variables (molecular species) in reactions and fluxes.
page.appearance:
There are two types of species that can be used in BioModel:
Regular species are defined by a green round shape and define variables.
Composite species are defined by a blue round shape and have an internal structure: they are composed of molecules. They can be used as regular species in any reaction network, but they also can serve as seed species in rule-based models: they are used as starting set of species to either generate a network (using BioNetGen software), or used as an initial set of species for stochastic Network-free simulations performed by (using NFSim software).
